abstract.text: Sets the properties of a tensor for the specified function argument.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The graph context.
The function. Specify as
if the graph only contains one function.
The name of the input or output argument.

A Boolean value that specifies whether the function should replace any dynamic shapes for the next execution of the context. BNNS derives these shapes either from the default shapes in the source model, or from a preceding calls to
or
. If BNNS is unable to derive the shapes, the function sets the dimensions to
The tensor. On output, all fields apart from
contain the properties for the specified function argument.
on success, nonzero on failure.

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
Sets the properties of a tensor for the specified function argument.
Sets the batch size for a graph.
Specifies the dynamic shapes for a graph and, if possible, infers, the output shapes.
Sets the stride of the specifed tensor for compatibility with the given model’s input or output argument based on its current shape.
A structure that describes the shape, stride, data type, and, optionally, the memory location of an n-dimensional array.
A pointer to the memory that contains the tensor values.
Returns the minimum allocation size, in bytes, of the specified tensor.
An object that wraps a compiled graph object.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
